p: The present study revealed that different parts of Anacyclus pyrethrum var. pyrethrum (L.) and Anacyclus pyrethrum var. depressus (Ball) Maire are rich in phytochemicals that may be involved in the antioxidant and antibacterial properties investigated in this work. In brief, the information presented here could serve as a valuable database for further research to exploit new natural substances present in different parts of the two varieties to fight free radical damage, and fungal and bacterial infections.
